summary: This is a General Release agreement from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP), signed by a claimant on October 3, 2020, accepting a compensation offer in exchange for releasing a broad range of individuals and entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein's estate from all claims related to his sexual abuse. The document outlines the terms of the release, confidentiality provisions, and lien resolution processes.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose estate and associated entities are being released from claims of sexual abuse by the claimant.

persons.name: Claimant
persons.context: An individual who submitted a claim to the EVCP, was determined eligible, accepted a compensation offer, and is signing this release to settle all claims against Epstein-associated parties.

persons.name: Administrator
persons.context: The official who runs the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, determines eligibility, issues compensation offers, and maintains claimant confidentiality.

connections.description: The claimant asserts she is a victim of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, which is the basis for her compensation claim.
The Administrator evaluated the claimant's submission, determined her eligibility for the EVCP, and issued the compensation offer she accepted.

events.title: Execution of EVCP General Release
events.description: A claimant signs a General Release agreement with the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, accepting a financial offer and releasing a wide array of Epstein-associated individuals and entities from all claims.

keyFacts: The document is a formal release where a victim accepts compensation from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and, in exchange, waives all claims against Jeffrey Epstein's estate, its trustees, and a vast network of associated individuals and entities.
The release is extremely broad, covering known and unknown claims, and specifically waives protections like California Civil Code Section 1542, which normally preserves unknown claims.
The agreement specifies that certain claims against an unnamed individual or entity (redacted) are expressly preserved and not released.
The claimant is represented by legal counsel and the document was notarized in Travis County, Texas.
The EVCP uses Garretson Resolution Group, Inc. (Epiq) to handle potential Medicare/Medicaid liens related to the compensation awards.
